attribute()

Apply different attribute operation based on arguments.length
  • setAttribute(name, value)
  • setAttributeNS(namespace, name, value)
  • getAttribute(name)
Source:
  • element.js, line 62

filter(filter, argument)

Apply filter on current element. If called multiple times, these filters will be chained together and combine to a bigger SVG filter.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter String BLUR, GRAY, INVERT, THRESHOLD, OPAQUE, ERODE, DILATE (defined in p5's constants)
argument Any Argument for that filter
Source:
  • element.js, line 87

matches(selector) → {Bool}

Tell if current element matching given selector. This is polyfill from MDN.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
selector String CSS Selector

Type
Bool

parentNode(selectoropt) → {SVGElement}

Get parentNode. If selector not given, returns parentNode. Otherwise, will look up all ancestors, and return closest element matching given selector, or return null if not found.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
selector String <optional>
 CSS Selector

SVGElement

selector String CSS selector for query

unfilter(filter, argument)

Remove applied filter on current element After called, rest filters will be chained together and combine to a new SVG filter.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
filter String BLUR, GRAY, INVERT, THRESHOLD, OPAQUE, ERODE, DILATE (defined in p5's constants)
argument Any Argument for that filter
